author: Andrew Kender
comment: After a day, it stopped working. I can't get the charging screen to show up without going in the phone app and manually turning it on, again. And I've rated the app but premium features never unlocked.
title: Doesn't even work

author: Sathyajith Vijayakumar
comment: It's a bit iffy... Have to open up the app on the phone to jump start it. Would be great if we could set manual location for weather. Good concept, just needs a bit more work to be a 4+.

author: Erica Brinkerhoff
comment: I like this app bc I can leave it on all night & don't have to worry about it burning in the screen. It's dims way down too so I'm not blinded in the middle of the night. Simple, yet has nice to have features like temp on the screensaver.
title: Nice bedside clock, no burn-in

author: PATRICK E HUDAK
comment: Now if somebody could only build an app like this to work in ambient mode on a regular basis, not just when charging that would be sweet especially with burn-in being such a problem with AMOLED displays
title: Works great on the Asus 2

author: Lee White
comment: Wish there was more screen selections. I'm back to getting the charging full alert on a loop. It just keeps sending it until you take it off the charger. Very a noting at 0300!
title: Great app!

author: Michael Solomon
comment: Better than the stock 360 charging screen,  mainly because I can dim it down to an acceptable level for overnight in a dark room. Doesn't always activate on charge though,  meaning I need to go into the app on my phone to enable it.
title: Better than stock

author: Keith Mitchell
comment: Very handy app. The ticwatch s has a night clock feature but it disappears after a few minutes which is useless. This app is a much better option and is particularly useful since the display can be rotated as needed.

author: Belmin Fernandez
comment: Used to work fine but Huawei just pushed out an update that has its own (less attractive) charging face. If there's a way to use this app instead, please let me know.
title: Great app but new Huawei update effectively disables it

author: Martin Gilbert
comment: Easy to set up and does exactly what it says in the description. The dim slider is very handy too, it doesn't keep me awake like a two million candle power torch, burning my retinas and rendering it useless.
title: Works fine on G Watch R

author: Tezza Tucker
comment: Used to love this app. But since  I had to reinstall it only shows for about 5 seconds. Also I previously made the donation to unlock it and now it's wanting me to do it again. Not paying twice.

author: Bob Mc. Joe
comment: Works well, little jittery at times but could be my watch. Good selection of backgrounds and colours. Overall it's a nice app, well worth looking at. (Moto 360 1st Gen)
title: Works well

author: Emmanuel Perez
comment: For the little amount of time I look at my watch while it is charging, I am satisfied. This charging face tells me the basics I need to know such as the weather or date at a quick glance, which the original Moto 360 charging face was lacking of. I recommend for you to give it a try.
title: My Review

author: Martine S
comment: Works not always immediately... Sometimes have to start up from my phone again. Clock isn't always the right time in the morning. But it is very nice that it dims the light.. but that should be possible in the charger anyway..

author: jose villarreal
comment: I bought the app.  Downloaded it to my phone but from there, I could never send it to my watch.  I really liked the overall design with the battery gauge in the circular formation.  It's unfortunate I never got to use it.

author: Sergio Riccetti Schubert
comment: It flips out occasionally and flashes on and off really fast even when off the charger. Also turns the vibration on and off incessantly once the watch is charged - really wish that was something I could toggle on or off
title: Seems to have gotten flaky

author: Dan Suzuki
comment: It doesn't always activate upon docking but gives me better optionality vs the default dock screen and allows you to adjust the brightness as well.
title: Great so far

author: Christopher Watkins
comment: Performance is a bit spotty. Sometimes it works automatically and sometimes it doesn't.
title: Spotty

author: Dwayne Bailey
comment: My watch (LG Urbane LTE 2nd Edition) already has a charging app that could serve a similar purpose to this app, but it was way too bright for use at night, and it would shut down once the watch was fully charged. Developer options provides a way around the second problem, but not the first. Enter this app. Works almost flawlessly for me. Displays the time and charge status, but keeps it dim enough not to keep me awake, and stays on until I unplug the charger.  The only minor issues I've seen relate to the interaction with the built-in charging app:  1. Sometime (I haven't been able to see a pattern yet) the built-in app comes up instead of this one, but a simple swipe on the screen allows me to move back and forth between each. Slightly annoying, but not a deal-breaker  2. Because the built-in app turns on auto-rotate, I need  to ignore the rotate features of this app, and always keep it set to unrotated. Again, not a problem, just took me a few minutes to figure out why the rotation wasn't working the way I expected.   All in all, just what I was looking for. If the interactions with the built-in charging app could be fixed, it would definitely rate a 5-star review

author: Jason Douglas
comment: Seems to require relaunching occasionally, which is mildly annoying. However, app makes watch much more useful while on charging stand and is therefore essential.

author: Colum T
comment: Works as described, but I wish the brightness slider would allow you to fully dim the display... Ask the way down to off.
title: Can't dim fully

author: Tharwat Abouhelal
comment: The app is awesome, but how to set weather location or make sure it's displaying my location? It's giving unrealistic measure.

author: scottandem03
comment: Would rate 5 stars but, it doesn't work. Won't show up instead of the  original charging screen. You have to go in and turn it on manually every time.
title: Doesn't work

author: Jason MacEmcy
comment: Doesn't work with Huawei watch running Wear 2.0. The stock widget just pops over it and I don't even get notified when it's done charging.

author: Chris Jubinsky
comment: This does excatly what it says. It opens when I go to charge my watch. One thing can be fixed is that I get a notified that my watch is fully charged at 99%.
title: Nearly Perfect

author: Craig M
comment: Edit: It's still happening. I am uninstalling the app. Despite the updates, I am still getting plenty of new notifications that my watch is fully charged when it isn't even on and/or connected.
title: STILL Getting notifications when watch is off

author: Marcel Carter
comment: Everything works very well now that I am using the most recent version of Android Wear.  If you're not using that,  then this app won't function properly.
title: Android wear must be newest update

author: Jim Thomas
comment: Very well done. Love all the customizing that can be done.  Make it nice and dim for at night and the weather thing makes it great to see what to throw on quickly in the mornings grade a
title: Very nice

author: Jordan
comment: Had a problem at first but it fixed when I reinstalled the application
title: Its great

author: Ike Morris
comment: It looks amazing while on the charger. My only complaint is that i wish you could turn off the weather widget.
title: I like it

author: Marc Bowes
comment: Doesn't start automatically, I have to open the app on the phone each time I place it on the charger.
title: Not working properly

author: Andre Champoux
comment: Weather displays under charge percentage.  Only stays on for a bit, then default charge display comes back.
title: Needs improvement

author: Thomas Stoehrmann
comment: I like the desk clock .. unfortunately it disappears after a notification and does not resume even still charging
title: Nice desk clock

author: Paul Everist
comment: I try loads of different apps and often end up removing them after a few days. This is one I am definitely keeping. It is simple and it works well, giving a useful graphic as to how far charging has progressed on your smartwatch
title: Simple and Effective

author: Jed Dye
comment: Good idea however it does not disable the stock charging screen so most of the time the stock one (with the green circle) takes over this app which renders it useless.

author: Justin Arnold
comment: Other than the weather widget, it works great. It's hit and miss.
title: Great app!

author: Rich R
comment: Thank you for making a great app that is needed for this Sony Watch....but it needs updating it seems.     5-8-2016......looks like the dev bailed on this app....needs work as it will not always open when you charge the watch.  To make work you have to open it again on phone to make work on watch. And temp read out is frozen on 9C always.

author: Hew Williams
comment: Great to have the ability to use my Huawei watch 2 as a clock as I did with my old Moto 360. HOWEVER: The clock face randomly turns to full brightness throughout the night. Tried emailing the developer but received no reply.

author: Erik Geurts
comment: Seems to be broken after my Moto 360 1st generation updated to Android 6.
title: Promising

author: Owen Rubin
comment: Love this for seeing how much charge and acting like a night stand clock. And being able to choose colors is an extra bonus

author: Simphiwe Miti
comment: Sometimes the smallest things can make the biggest difference! Nice and clean UI... especially love the watch faces!
title: Very Useful
